title: Bayesian Point Estimation: Posterior Mean and MAP
contentHtml: In Bayesian statistics, we often need to estimate population parameters from a sample. The posterior mean and maximum a posteriori (MAP) are two key concepts in Bayesian point estimation.
name: Posterior Mean
problemHtml: Suppose we have a dataset of exam scores and want to estimate the true average score. We assume a normal distribution with unknown mean and variance.
